climbs.name: Black and Tan
climbs.fa: Andy Ross, Gene Valee, Paul Ross  16th Oct  2011

content.description: A fine sustained slab route with good protection.Climbed on sight pro placed on lead.Walk through the canyon to where the first gully appears on the left . The slab forms the corner buttress. Follow  six bolts up the slab to double anchors.100' 5.9 Rap the route.
content.location: One Finger Canyon . About half hour hike south of Two Fingers Canyon

content.description:
Start 20 ft lower than Brown Girl in the Ring.

Move right to a small left facing corner, then up this to the first bolt.

Some great climbing on the exposed arete then move left to join Brown Girl.. finish.

Great rock.
content.protection:
Bolts.

3" cam between the last 2 bolts.
content.location:
The arete right of Brown Girl in the Ring.

Double rope rappel.

content.description:
Starts about 100 yards from the canyon entrance on its left side. As the title suggests the sting is in the tail.

P1) Enter the groove and climb passed nine bolts and some cam placements .The steeper section just below the belay is the tricky bit. 200' 5.10-
content.protection: A few cams 1/2" to 2" two 60m ropes for the rap . Slings.
content.location: Located in One Finger Canyon about a half hour hike south from Two Finger Canyon.

content.description: Climbs the obvious corner right of Higher the Better. See Topo. P1) Climb the corner 6 bolts and cam protection to finish at the belay of Higher the Better.One can continue up Higher the Better 150' 5.10
content.protection: Cams from TUC to 3.5 inches . Stoppers ,slings .Two 60m ropes for rap.
content.location: One Finger Canyon .half hour hike south of Two Finger Canyon.

climbs.name: Illusion
climbs.fa: Harry Lime. Paul Ross. Jose Huggins

content.description:
Climbs the slab to the right of the massive unclimbed wall at the right end of the canyon. Scramble up the talus to below and right of the obvious groove.

P1) Enter the groove from the right past one bolt. Continue up the groove past another bolt and cams to a ledge. Move left about 20' to a left-facing corner/ramp and up this past a steep crack to ledge and cam belay (3") 200' 5.7.

Descent: traverse right for about 60' to double anchors. Two rope rap to ground.

climbs.name: Higher the Better
climbs.fa: Paul Ross Kent Wheeler  ( Var leads )15th Oct 2011

content.description:
Starts up the Buttress and ends at a hand crack high on the ridge.See topo Photo.

P1) Climb the slab passed  four bolts to double anchors.110'5.7+.

P2) Enter the short corner above the belay and continue up easier slab to the creast of the ridge (natural belays)110'5.6.

P3)Scramble along the ridge to the foot of the obvious crack.Cam belay .60'.

P4)Climb the fine crack .50' 5.10-

Descent:- Rap from double anchors at the top of the crack directly into gully then scramble down to start.
content.protection: Cams from 1/2 inch to 3.5 inch. Stoppers.Two 60m ropes. Slings
content.location: New One Finger Canyon .Half hour hike south of Two Finger Canyon.

content.description: Start in the groove, then move right on to a nice face with squarecuts. Pull the bulge then blast up the arete to the top.
content.protection:
Bolts.

1/2" cam between bolts 1 & 2.

3" cam between the last 2 bolts.
content.location:
One Finger Canyon . About half hour hike south of Two Fingers Canyon

Starts up the same groove as Kents Corner then moves right at the first bolt.

Double rope rappel.

climbs.name: Borrowdale Tower
climbs.fa: Harry Lime. Paul Ross. Jose Huggins April 2015

content.description:
The blocky tower is visible on the right as one enters the canyon. See Pic.

P1) Starts at a slab on the front part of the formation. Climb about 20' to a bolt. Pass the bolt and move left passing a good thread. Continue up left to a groove, which is followed(wires for pro). At the top of the groove move left to the arete. Follow this to a bolt, then up a crack then back to another bolt at the base of an obvious corner(crux). Follow the corner past two bolts and a 2" cam. Then up easy chimney to a step up left past a bolt to a fine summit. 200' 5.9.

Descent. Rap into the gap, and then a two rope rap from double anchors on the other side of the tower.
content.protection: Cams 1/2" to 3". Long slings to help rope drag.  A set of wires.

pathTokens: Eastern Reef Area.. AKA The Sandstone Alps
